feed.title: Terra Nova (National Park) - Weather - Environment Canada

entry.title: No watches or warnings in effect, Terra Nova (National Park)
entry.summary: No watches or warnings in effect.

entry.title: Monday night: Snow or rain. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning.
entry.summary: Snow changing to rain overnight. Fog patches developing overnight. Snowfall amount 5 to 10 cm. Rainfall amount 5 mm. Wind southwest 20 km/h becoming southeast 20 gusting to 40 this evening then increasing to 40 gusting to 60 except gusting to 80 along parts of the coast overnight. Temperature rising to plus 4 by morning. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 23 January 2023

entry.title: Tuesday: Rain. High 7.
entry.summary: Rain ending near noon then cloudy with 40 percent chance of showers. Fog patches dissipating in the afternoon. Amount 2 to 4 mm. Wind southeast 40 km/h gusting to 60 except gusting to 80 along parts of the coast in the morning. Wind becoming south 30 gusting to 50 near noon. High 7. UV index 1 or low. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 23 January 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: Chance of showers. Low minus 3. POP 40%
entry.summary: Mainly cloudy. 40 percent chance of showers early in the evening. Wind south 30 km/h gusting to 50 becoming west 40 gusting to 60 in the evening. Low minus 3. Wind chill minus 11 overnight. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 23 January 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Chance of flurries. High minus 2. POP 40%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud with 40 percent chance of flurries. High minus 2. Forecast issued 4:00 PM NST Monday 23 January 2023
